citation.article-title: Characterization of a new platelet-forming purple sulfur bacterium Amoebobacter pedioformis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Amoebobacter, pedioformis sp. nov.
Amoebobacter, pedioformis (pe.di.o.for'mis. Gr.n. pedion a plain, a flat area; L.n. forma shape; M.L. adj. pedioformis flat-shaped)
Spherical to oval cells occur singly or in regular platelets of 4 to 16 cells.
Individual cells 2x2-3 μm in size; nonmotile.
Contain elongated gas vacuoles in the peripheral parts of the cells.
Contain bacteriochlorophyll a, spirilloxanthin, anhydrorhodovibrin, rhodopin and OH-spirilloxanthin.
Phototrophic under anaerobic conditions or chemoautotrophic under microaerobic conditions in the dark.
Electron donors used for photoautotrophic growth: hydrogen sulfide, elemental sulfur, and thiosulfate.
Globules of elemental sulfur are stored inside the cells as intermediary product.
In the presence of sulfide and bicarbonate, acetate, lactate and pyruvate are photoassimilated.
Chemolithoautotrophic growth is possible with hydrogen sulfide and thiosulfate as electron donors.
Optimum-temperature 37°C Habitat: Isolated from a waste water pond.
DNA base ratio: 65.5±1.0 mol% guanine plus cytosine.
